solution_line_template: Celine was charged ${daily_charge_fifty_cents} * {days_book1_borrowed} = $<<{daily_charge_fifty_cents}*{days_book1_borrowed}={cost_book1}>>{cost_book1} for the book she returned to the library after {days_book1_borrowed} days.

If the other two books stayed at her house until the end of May, she paid {days_in_may}*${daily_charge_fifty_cents}= $<<{days_in_may}*{daily_charge_half_dollar}={cost_per_book_may}>>{cost_per_book_may} for each book.

For the {num_books_remaining} books that stayed at her house until the end of May, Celine paid ${cost_per_book_may}*{num_books_remaining} = $<<{cost_per_book_may}*{num_books_remaining}={total_cost_books_may}>>{total_cost_books_may}
